The nominal origin os the forms ol the Infinitive was sorgotten and they were no longer regarded as case forms. For instance, as the ending -αι was not preserved for the l dative ol nouus, the origin os δόμεν-αι was lost sight of, and it was brought into close connexion with the different stems ol the verb. As beside ἔδοσαν there stood δώσουσι, so beside κ δόμεναι rose δωσέμεναι, and other infinitives for the different tenses, with constructions similar to those ol the Finite Verb.
